intro: Hyoseris lucida subsp. lucida, commonly known as the shining sunflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of North America. It is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and dark brown central disk, resembling a small sunflower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces numerous small, tubular disc flowers surrounded by petal-like rays. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in prairies and open woodlands. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
